Detailed Description

The environmental defines are enabled internally due to the settings build environment.

The environmental defines are internally created within the make process based on the configuration of the system build environment and must not be declared explicitly. The system build environment includes for example operating system, protocol stack interface, compiler, platform, build mode, target system, and so on. Once the setup is done it should not be changed. Only for reasons of migration to a new system environment adaptations in the mapping of the system build variables to the environmental defines have to be done.

In CBE this setup is established whether in the file apoxi_makeoptions.mk or in the file cbe_apoxi_makeoptions.mk located in the directory ${GLOBALPATH}/lnz_apoxi/Apoxi.

The platform integrator has to care to setup the system build environment (e.g. via ${GLOBALPATH}/system-build/make/project.config.default) accordingly.


Naming convention for new created environmental defines:

APOXI_<system_environment_group>_<system_environment>, where

  • <system_environment_group> defines the type of the system environment, like RTOS, COMPILER, PLATFORM, BUILDMODE, etc.
  • <system_environment> describes a specific element of the system environment, like (in case of <system_environment_group> == RTOS) WIN32, NUC32, LINUX, and so on.

Define Documentation

#define APOXI_3GPP_REL_4_5
 

Stack interface define to support 3GPP Release 4/5

This define is enabled to achieve compliance to the protocol stack interface for 3GPP Release 4 and Release 5 builds and is used for protocol stack specific implementation in APOXI.

The define is set dependent to the environment variable ${PLATFORM} (e.g. set via project.config.default).

#define APOXI_3GPP_REL_99
 

Stack interface define to support 3GPP Release 99

This define is enabled to achieve compliance to the protocol stack interface for 3GPP Release 99 builds and is used for protocol stack specific implementation in APOXI.

The define is set dependent to the environment variable ${PLATFORM} (e.g. set via project.config.default).

#define APOXI_BIG_ENDIAN
 

Define for Big Endian support.

Depending on the computing system the byte order in which multi byte numbers are stored has to be defined.

See also:
APOXI_LITTLE_ENDIAN

#define APOXI_COMPILER_ADS
 

Compiler define for ARM Developer Suite (ADS) compiler

This define is enabled, when ADS compiler is used. It can be used to cover the code in APOXI, which is specific to the ADS compiler, to handle compiler restrictions or features.

The define is enabled by and based on the environment variable ${COMPILER} (e.g. set via project.config.default).

#define APOXI_COMPILER_C166
 

Compiler define for Tasking C166 compiler

This define is enabled, when C166 compiler is used. It can be used to cover the code in APOXI, which is specific to the C166 compiler, to handle compiler restrictions or features.

The define is enabled by and based on the environment variable ${COMPILER} (e.g. set via project.config.default).

#define APOXI_COMPILER_MSVC
 

Compiler define for Microsoft Visual C/C++ (MSVC) compiler

This define is enabled, when MSVC compiler is used. It can be used to cover the code in APOXI, which is specific to the MSVC compiler, to handle compiler restrictions or features.

The define is enabled by and based on the environment variable ${COMPILER} (e.g. set via project.config.default).

#define APOXI_COMPILER_RVCT
 

Compiler define for RealView Compilation Tools (RVCT) compiler

This define is enabled, when RVCT compiler is used. It can be used to cover the code in APOXI, which is specific to the RVCT compiler, to handle compiler restrictions or features.

The define is enabled by and based on the environment variable ${COMPILER} (e.g. set via project.config.default).

#define APOXI_ICC_SIM
 

Define for support of the ICC SIM

This define is enabled to support the functionality of integrated circuit card SIM (subscriber identity module) and is used for ICC implementation in APOXI.

The define is set dependent to the environment variable ${PLATFORM} (e.g. set via project.config.default).

#define APOXI_ICC_USIM
 

Define for support of the ICC USIM

This define is enabled to support the functionality of integrated circuit card USIM (universal subscriber identity module) and is used for ICC implementation in APOXI.

The define is set dependent to the environment variable ${PLATFORM} (e.g. set via project.config.default).

#define APOXI_LITTLE_ENDIAN
 

Define for Little Endian support.

Depending on the computing system the byte order in which multi byte numbers are stored has to be defined.

See also:
APOXI_BIG_ENDIAN

#define APOXI_PLATFORM_BP30
 

Platform define for BP30

This define is enabled for every build for the platform BP30 and is used for platform specific implementation in APOXI.

The define is enabled by and based on the environment variable ${PLATFORM} (e.g. set via project.config.default).


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_PROJ_BP30
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0

#define APOXI_PLATFORM_MP1U
 

Platform define for MP1U

This define is enabled for every build for the platform MP1U and is used for platform specific implementation in APOXI.

The define is enabled by and based on the environment variable ${PLATFORM} (e.g. set via project.config.default).


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_PROJ_SGOLD
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0

#define APOXI_PLATFORM_MPE
 

Platform define for MP-E

This define is enabled for every build for the platform MP-E and is used for platform specific implementation in APOXI.

The define is enabled by and based on the environment variable ${PLATFORM} (e.g. set via project.config.default).


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_PROJ_MPE
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0

#define APOXI_PLATFORM_MPEU
 

Platform define for MP-EU

This define is enabled for every build for the platform MP-EU and is used for platform specific implementation in APOXI.

The define is enabled by and based on the environment variable ${PLATFORM} (e.g. set via project.config.default).

#define APOXI_RAT_DUAL
 

Define for support of the dual mode RAT

This define is enabled to support the dual mode (GSM & UMTS) radio technology features provided by the according stack and is used for dual mode specific implementation in APOXI.

The define is set dependent to the environment variables ${PLATFORM} and ${STACK} (e.g. set via project.config.default).

#define APOXI_RAT_GSM
 

Define for support of the single mode RAT GSM

This define is enabled to support the single mode radio technology features of GSM (Global System for Mobile communications) provided by the according stack and is used for GSM single mode RAT specific implementation in APOXI.

The define is set dependent to the environment variables ${PLATFORM} and ${STACK} (e.g. set via project.config.default).

#define APOXI_RAT_UMTS
 

Define for support of the single mode RAT GSM

This define is enabled to support the single mode radio technology features of UMTS (Universal Mobile Telecommunications System) provided by the according stack and is used for UMTS single mode RAT specific implementation in APOXI.

The define is set dependent to the environment variables ${PLATFORM} and ${STACK} (e.g. set via project.config.default).

#define APOXI_RTOS_LINUX
 

(Real time) operating system define for Linux

This define is enabled for every build on the operating system Linux and is used for OS specific implementation in APOXI. This operating system is used for host simulation and target integration.

The define is enabled by and based on the environment variable ${PLATFORMOS} (e.g. set via project.config.default).

#define APOXI_RTOS_NUC32
 

(Real time) operating system define for Nucleus 32bit

This define is enabled for every build on the 32bit real time operating system of Nucleus and is used for OS specific implementation in APOXI. This operating system is used only for target integration.

The define is enabled by and based on the environment variable ${PLATFORMOS} (e.g. set via project.config.default).

#define APOXI_RTOS_OSE166
 

(Real time) operating system define for OSE166

This define is enabled for every build on the 16bit real time operating system OSE166 and is used for OS specific implementation in APOXI. This operating system is used only for target integration.

The define is enabled by and based on the environment variable ${PLATFORMOS} (e.g. set via project.config.default).

#define APOXI_RTOS_WIN32
 

(Real time) operating system define for Windows 32bit

This define is enabled for every build on the 32bit operating system of Windows and is used for OS specific implementation in APOXI. This operating system is used only for host simulation.

The define is enabled by and based on the environment variable ${PLATFORMOS} (e.g. set via project.config.default).

#define APOXI_TARGETSYSTEM_HOST
 

Host build environment define

This define is active for every host build and is used host simulation specific implementation.

The define is enabled by and based on the environment variable ${TARGETSYSTEM} (e.g. set via project.config.default).


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_HOST_BUILD
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0

#define APOXI_TARGETSYSTEM_HW
 

Target build environment define

This define is active for every target (HW) build and is used target build specific implementation.

The define is enabled by and based on the environment variable ${TARGETSYSTEM} (e.g. set via project.config.default).


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_TARGET_BUILD
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0
